title: Understanding $$p-values$$
text: A $$p-value$$ is a measure of the probability that an observed difference could have occurred just by random chance. In hypothesis testing, it helps determine the significance of your results.

title: Threshold for significance
text: In many scientific studies, a $$p-value$$ threshold of $$0.05$$ is commonly used to determine statistical significance. This means that there is a 5% chance that the observed results are due to random variation.

title: Interpreting $$p-values$$
text: If the $$p-value$$ is less than $$0.05$$, it suggests that the null hypothesis can be rejected, indicating that the results are statistically significant.

title: Choosing the correct interpretation
text: Given a $$p-value$$ less than $$0.05$$, what does this imply about the statistical significance of the test results?
choices: The result is not statistically significant
The sample size is too small
